attributes.action: Allow fans to attend football matches up to (and inc) National League level
attributes.additional_details:
Football at this level is distinct from the Premier League/EFL. There are no lucrative television contracts to keep the club afloat whilst spectators are unable to attend. The strength of English football is solely reliant on the health of the "football pyramid". If the lower leagues crumble, the top flight suffers too.

It is vital (and perfectly feasible), for spectators to attend matches at this level on a socially distanced basis, whilst upholding the Government's rule of 6.
attributes.background: Football clubs at National League Level (and below) rely entirely on match day income generated from fans to survive. These community driven clubs are often operated with the help of dedicated volunteers and any money raised from ticket sales is generally reinvested straight back into the clubs.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334366.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
